1.1.generation:
**Project Overview**

The primary objective of the initiative is the widespread distribution of fuel-efficient improved cookstoves (ICS) in India. These advanced cookstoves are intended to supplant the less efficient traditional stoves currently in use. By facilitating the deployment and adoption of high thermal efficiency ICS in households, the project aims to enhance energy conservation and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The improved combustion mechanism of the ICS leads to more effective wood utilization, resulting in decreased fuel wood consumption and lower emissions of greenhouse gases. This transition not only combats deforestation but also mitigates health risks associated with indoor air pollution, particularly for women and children. Given the financial constraints of the target demographic, the project sponsors have opted to provide the ICS free of charge. End users are educated in advance about the carbon finance generated through the use of ICS, which is utilized to offset the costs of the stoves and project implementation. The initial phase of the project is concentrated in the Assam state of India, with potential expansion to other regions detailed in Section 1.12. The ICS will serve as a substitute for the prevalent practice of cooking over open fires. The baseline scenario involves the continued use of non-renewable biomass by the target population in the absence of project intervention. The first project activity instance is scheduled for implementation on 01-February-2024, encompassing 1,000 ICS installations. The project envisions the potential deployment of up to 1,000,000 ICS in subsequent phases. EKI Energy Services Limited will centrally oversee the implementation, greenhouse gas accounting, and monitoring activities. The estimated annual greenhouse gas emission reduction for 1,000 project instances is 6,956 tCO2e, with a total reduction of 48,689 tCO2e projected for the entire crediting period.
